titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Herbert Edward Palmer, 1931-1957, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

did.abstract: The Palmer, H.E. mss., 1931-1957, are letters and inscriptions of Herbert Edward Palmer, 1880-1961, an English poet, which were removed from printed works in the Book Collection of the Lilly Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Herbert Edward Palmer, 1880-1961, was an English poet, journalist, and literary critic. He was born in Market Rasen, Lincolnshire and educated at Woodhouse Grove School, Birmingham University, and Bonn University. He worked for the Workers Educational Association before becoming a full-time writer. He was the mentor of British writer and poet John Gawsworth. Palmer's notable works include The Armed Muse (1930, Hogarth Press), The Judgement of François Villon: A Pageant Episode in Five Acts (1927), and Songs of Salvation, Sin, and Satire (1925, Hogarth Press).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Palmer, H.E. mss., 1931-1957, are letters and inscriptions of Herbert Edward Palmer, 1880-1961, an English poet, which were removed from printed works in the Book Collection of the Lilly Library.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Palmer, H.E. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
